weatherForecast.comment:
High air pressure brings us sunny mountain weather on St. Stephen's Day. In the Koralpe area, there is still some fog at the beginning, which disappears in the morning. A moderate easterly wind makes it milder.
The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will rise from -5 to -0 degrees during the day. A moderate wind from the south-east.
On Saturday it will remain sunny and it will be even milder.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Up to 30 cm of new fallen snow, but the avalanche danger remains low.
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. Nevertheless, small, spontaneous loose snow avalanches can be expected from steep terrain as the weather warms up and the sun shines.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 30 cm of new fallen snow has fallen in the Koralpe area since Wednesday. The new fallen snow only covers hard persistent weak layers in shady gullies and bowls above the tree line in the northern sector, otherwise it fell on apery ground.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger will remain low over the next few days.

weatherForecast.comment:
High air pressure will bring us sunny mountain weather on St. Stephen's Day. A moderate easterly wind will make it a little milder. At an altitude of 2000 metres, temperatures will rise from -1 degree to +1 degree during the day.
Saturday will remain sunny and it will be even milder.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Very little snow, low avalanche danger.
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is generally low. Avalanche prone locations can be found at high altitudes in extremely steep gullies in the northern sector, where small slab avalanches can occasionally be triggered by large additional loads. The danger of falling dominates over the danger of avalanches!

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow surface is mostly hard and icy, with slopes up to over 2000 metres above sea level on sunny slopes. A few centimetres of new fallen snow were added on Wednesday. Below the melting snow crust, kinetic metamorphism is weakening the snow layering on the northern sides.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger will remain low in the coming days.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: New fallen snow on the Koralpe, but generally still very little snow.
